meanings.definition: A white crystalline compound used in making plastics and for other purposes.
meanings.sent1: The factory produced melamines for creating durable plastic products.
meanings.sent2: The melamines were essential in the production of strong and long-lasting materials.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally spilled melamines all over the lab, creating a plastic mess.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a bag of melamines, molding ideas into solid structures.
meanings.sent5: The bright white color of melamines made them stand out in the workshop.

meanings.definition: A type of resin made from melamine and formaldehyde, used in laminates and adhesives.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter applied melamines to the furniture to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent2: Melamines are commonly used in the construction industry for their adhesive properties.
meanings.sent3: The artist mistakenly used melamines instead of paint, resulting in a sticky masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was as strong as the melamines holding the pieces together.
meanings.sent5: The smell of melamines lingered in the air after the renovation project.
